title: Crowbar.-.Discography. . 1991- 2011  320k  mp3  ak
description:
Crowbar - Discography (1991-2011) 320k mp3



1989. That's 20 long years ago.  Memories. Some  vivid, most just a blur. 
The one constant thing has been focus and desire. 
The same vision they had in '89 is still burning strong. 
Fuelled by the down-tuned sludge of the Melvins, and the aggression of Peter Steele's Carnivore, They created a beast and Crowbar was born. 
The band's sound was labelled DOOM-CORE by the Euro press shortly after the 1992 debut release 'Obedience thru Suffering'. 


Crowbar have released 7 full-length CDs, the second selling over 100,000 copies worldwide. 
They threw in a live EP and a few best-of compilations for good measure and are now ready to unleash 'Lifesblood for the Downtrodden' in early 2005. 
Anyone who knows Crowbar is familiar with the numerous label and line-up changes over the years. 
 A solid new line-up for this re-birth of sorts. They recruited Rex Brown (Pantera, Down), Craig Nunenmacher (Black Label Society, CROWBAR) and Warren Riker (DOWN II) for the recording and producing of this monster, and All are  very pleased with the outcome. 
These 11 tracks show an equally dangerous, more mature Crowbar. One part aggression, one part melodic, all parts Heavy!! 
This is a natural growth for a band that didn't know the fret board went above 5 frets back in '89. 
A natural growth in the song writing and vocal style. 

A step forward - period. 
After a two-and-a-half-year hiatus they recorded and toured with DOWN, Crowbar hit the stage for the first time on June,24th. 2004 in the Netherlands. 
This was the first show since October 2001. 

The new line-up Kirk Windstein (vocals/guitar), Steve Gibb (guitar), Tommy Buckley (drums), and Pat Bruders (bass) proved to be crushing from the first few chords. 
Their two week European tour was a big success with the highlight being a storming set at the withe Force fest in Leipzig, Germany. 
With the release of the new CD fast approaching, they were ready to hit the road and lay down the law wherever they play. 
The old dog might be getting older, but just might hang around another 20 years!!


Current members:
 
1989-   Kirk Windstein - vocals, guitars, bass
2005-   Tommy Buckley - drums
2005-   Patrick Bruders - bass
2009-   Matthew Brunson - guitar
